item.title: Failing Randomly: Linux Seccomp and Kernel Hacking
item.description: Seccomp filters system calls with cBPF code. One can blacklist certain system call numbers or even make a decision based on call arguments. Both Docker and Chromium use seccomp to protect host from malicious or misbehaving programs. With seccomp we can make a syscall fail consistently. We can’t make a syscall fail with a certain probability though. How hard could it be to extend seccomp for a complete kernel newbie?

item.title: A new era of aerial combat. – Tochnyi.info
item.description: In a first for modern warfare, the Ukrainian Defense Forces have been using FPV drones to intercept Russian surveillance drones and other UAVs. In recent months, a variety of published sources have included video evidence showing the considerable success Ukraine has had in doing so. This article examines aggregated open-source data on interceptions of Russian “fixed-wing” drones.

item.title: No, You can’t bet on everything (and that’s okay)
item.description: Prediction markets, despite their theoretical promise and success in sports ($330B US betting volume) and elections ($40B in 2024), are unlikely to become mainstream for all future events due to fundamental demand and liquidity constraints. The core issue isn’t regulation or technology - it’s that none of the three key market participants find prediction markets appealing: gamblers want quick resolutions (42% of 2020 election volume traded in final week), long-term investors prefer growing wealth in traditional assets, and market makers can’t operate without consistent retail flow (there is no demand for betting on topics except elections and sports).

item.title: Lies, damned lies, and Impact Hero (refoorest, allcolibri)
item.description: I found 17 extensions using the Impact Hero SDK in Chrome Web Store. These mislead users about their functionality, enable it without real consent, then lie about its ecological impact. And there is more shady stuff going on.

item.title: Seeing the World Through Your Field
item.description: Something funny happens if you work in a particular field long enough, which is that you start to see everything that happens through the lens of the field you work in. For example, my current company (Cerebrum) operates in the background screening space. So I’ve started to see everything through the lens of background checks. Economic news is about companies, and news about companies is really news about the people in those companies, which is really news about who those people are hiring, which is really news about the background screening industry.

item.title: Wiki - SurveyOfSystemLanguages2024
item.description: In case you missed it, there’s a whole new generation of low-level programming languages being created right now. Rust demonstrated vividly in 2016 that there is a massive unmet need in this space, and it has spawned a bunch of successor languages, though none of them have really hit the relative big-time like Rust has. I’m one of those programmers that has spent 20 years or so asking “can we PLEASE do low-level code in anything besides C and C++?” so I wanted to take an actual look at the languages I know about and do a bit of compare-and-contrast.

item.title: Build AI Agents in Minutes with AutoGen Studio | Complete Guide and Live Demo
item.description:
Get a subscription and improve your career: https://courses.devs.school
Unlock the power of AutoGen Studio to create intelligent agents and workflows effortlessly! In this video, I guide you step-by-step through this revolutionary tool powered by Azure OpenAI, designed to streamline the development of AI-driven automation and multi-agent systems.
In this video, you will learn:
What AutoGen Studio is and how it works.
How to configure AI agents with custom skills.
How to define complex workflows and multi-agent conversations.
Practical demos: Generating images, PDF documents, PowerPoint slides, and more.
If you are a developer, AI enthusiast, or looking to streamline AI-driven projects, AutoGen Studio is the tool you need to explore. Empower your creativity and productivity with this game-changing platform!
Links mentioned in the video:
Official Repository: https://github.com/microsoft/AutoGen
If you find this content helpful, don’t forget to like, subscribe, and hit the bell icon for more AI and tech tutorials!
